action.action-desc: Mr. Burgess (for himself and Mr. DeFazio) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XI of the Social Security Act to exempt from manufacturer transparency reporting certain transfers used for educational purposes, and for other purposes.

section.header: Exempting from manufacturer transparency reporting certain transfers used for educational purposes

subsection.text: Section 1128G(e)(10)(B) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320a–7h(e)(10)(B)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (iii), by inserting , including peer-reviewed journals, journal reprints, journal supplements, conference reports, and medical textbooks after patient use; and
by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: A transfer of anything of value to a covered recipient who is a physician if the thing of value is intended solely for purposes of providing continuing medical education to the physician or other physicians.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to transfers of value made on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
